text.p: The Turkish central bank funded banks with 28.7 trillion lira overnight cash at 75 percent on Friday when the market was squeezed for fresh cash ahead of the weekend.
Overnight money rates kept at 74.75-75 percent during the day as banks raised cash demands ahead of the weekend.
The lira firmed to 86,250 per dollar from 86,400 Thursday close due to cash shortage and lower dollar/mark parity.
The central bank lowered its dollar rate for banks' compulsory currency transfers twice due to parity movements and closed it at 86,300 lira, down 100 lira from opening.
T-bill yields were slightly higher due to cash demand but volume remained thin.
The most active December 4 paper yield firmed to 117.72 percent from 116.40 percent.
The second active one was February 26 paper. Its yield rose to 129.48 percent from 129.15 Thursday.
